intro: Coulterina didymocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved culterina, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, narrow leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting native wildlife.
